column2: A massive tower on the wall adding great strength to the castle. With its intricate earthwork and defenses, the castle is near impenetrable.
A Place where new weaponry is made and upgraded. With this building you are able to appoint a court Blacksmith to craft weapons of your choosing.
A very well decorated courtyard for you and your court to relax and enjoy simple pleasures.
A tavern which adds a boost to the economy.
A well dug moat to help slow enimies down.
A well to provide water throughout the castle.
A place to craft new ships for your fleet.
Improved crenellations to aid in the defense of your castle.
A upgrade to the gates so that it will take longer to be breached.
A grand fireplace for your dining hall.
A place for your men to sleep other than tents
An Improved sleeping quarters for your men,
A set of towers to keep watch and help defend your fort.
A Tent for the commanding officer.
A much better place for managing the fort and its soldiers.
A tavern for the city that makes a nice trickle of gold.
A place to keep the unlawful or well anyone you want.
A place for the town garrison to store there armor and weapons.
A place for a smith to forge your armies weapons.
Fields for growing crops for your people and to sell.
A bigger and greater amount of land for farms.
A place for the sinful to rest.
A place for prisoners of all kinds.
A courtyard with space for a statue or fountain.
An upgraded courtyard with a nice fountain.
A room made for planning strategies for war.
A place for the dead to rest.
A nice lighthouse to help ships reach the docks safley.
A bunch of camps spread around the county to help the sick.
A place for merchants to store goods.
A place for traders to gather from many lands.
A place for merchants to oversee the trade camp.
A place where the fleets supplies can be stored so that they may protect your trade.
A small building to provide soup to the poor at cost.
Solid Stone walls that make any fort powerfull.
Much better than the simple wooden tower these mighty structures will make your foes tremble
A much larger barracks to garrison many more troops.
A small investment that will slowly generate the family money.
A larger investment of money that will make your family rich.
Upgrading all the camps to clinics will help fight disease and epidemics.
Burn the bodies of those who are infected to prevent spreading.
Filled with hot oil that can be set alight these cauldrons are a deadly siege defense.
A Upgraded throne room to impress all.
A Sacred place for pagans to worship their gods.
Even stronger gates with iron platings
A place for your entire family to rest
A outpost for merchants to rest and relax before the next voyage.
A place to house a small group of loyal guards.
A hall for some loyal soldiers to eat and sleep.
Where markings a left to tell the stories of the dead.
A place where the darkest of trades takes place.
A place fit for a chieftan.
A hall fit for a king.
A fair amount of ballistas to help defend your walls.
A single ballista tower to protect the fort.
A couple of trebuchets to help stop enemies from getting close.
A place for artists of all kinds to work.
A Ditch dug out on the outside of walls and filled with wooden spikes at the bottom.
An ideal area for your troops to gather before marching.
A group of tents to set up a tavern.
A larger group of tents to set up a travelling tavern.
A small amount of ballistas placed around the trade post.
A set of fancy banners to represent your household.
A set of fancy banners to represent your household.
A set of fancy banners to represent your household.
Road tolls in the region to increase profits.
Road tolls in the region to increase profits.
Road tolls in the region to increase profits.
Road tolls in the region to increase profits.
A place to hange the law breakers of the region.
A place to hange the law breakers of the region.
An outpost to give early warning of hostile armies.
An outpost to give early warning of hostile armies.
A place for the men to spare
A place for the men to spare
A place for archers to hunt food and feed the people.
A place for archers to hunt food and feed the people.
